1.premise: Outcome Measurement: Percentage of Patients Achieving FEV1 Improvement ≥15% After 6 Weeks of Inhaled Budesonide. Spirometry was performed at baseline and at Week 6. Time frame: 6 weeks. Results: 54.8% (17/31) met the improvement threshold.
1.statement: Inhaled budesonide improves lung function in patients.
1.label: neutral

2.premise: Adverse Events Summary: Total: 6/14 (42.86%). Neutropenia 2/14 (14.29%), Peripheral neuropathy 1/14 (7.14%), Diarrhea 2/14 (14.29%), Hyponatremia 1/14 (7.14%).
2.statement: The treatment was effective but associated with risks to immune function and nerve health.
2.label: neutral

3.premise: Outcome Measurement: Proportion of Patients With Resting Heart Rate <80 bpm at Week 12 After Ivabradine Therapy. Baseline average: 94 bpm. Results: 61.9% (26/42) achieved the target. Time frame: 12 weeks.
3.statement: Ivabradine lowers resting heart rate in patients.
3.label: neutral

4.premise: Outcome Measurement: Percentage of Participants With Fasting Plasma Glucose <100 mg/dL After 16 Weeks of Pioglitazone. Baseline and Week 16 measurements taken. Results: 47.6% (20/42) reached the target. Time frame: 16 weeks.
4.statement: Pioglitazone causes a reduction in fasting plasma glucose levels.
4.label: neutral

5.premise: Adverse Events: Total: 8/22 (36.36%). Elevated creatinine 2/22 (9.09%), Ankle edema 3/22 (13.64%), Hypotension 2/22 (9.09%), Fatigue 1/22 (4.55%).
5.statement: The treatment was effective but some patients experienced kidney function changes, swelling, and low blood pressure.
5.label: neutral

6.premise: Adverse Events Summary: Total: 4/12 (33.33%). Headache 2/12 (16.67%), Pruritus 1/12 (8.33%), Mild anemia 1/12 (8.33%). All events were Grade 1 or 2.
6.statement: The drug was effective and well tolerated, with only mild side effects reported.
6.label: neutral

7.premise: Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events: 5/16 (31.25%). Hyperkalemia 1/16 (6.25%), Dizziness 2/16 (12.50%), Palpitations 1/16 (6.25%), Constipation 1/16 (6.25%).
7.statement: The treatment improved outcomes but some patients experienced electrolyte imbalances and cardiovascular symptoms.
7.label: neutral

8.premise: Outcome: Percentage of patients achieving serum uric acid <6 mg/dL after 10 weeks of allopurinol. Results: 69.2% (18/26) achieved the target. Time frame: 10 weeks.
8.statement: Allopurinol effectively lowers serum uric acid in most patients.
8.label: neutral

9.premise: Outcome: Rate of complete lesion clearance at Week 4 following topical 5-fluorouracil application for actinic keratosis. 55% (11/20) achieved complete clearance. Time frame: 4 weeks.
9.statement: Topical 5-fluorouracil accelerates lesion clearance in actinic keratosis.
9.label: neutral

10.premise: Outcome: Percentage of participants with ≥50% reduction in weekly migraine days at Week 8 following galcanezumab injections. 62.5% (15/24) met the reduction threshold. No control group included.
10.statement: Galcanezumab reduces migraine frequency significantly by Week 8.
10.label: neutral

11.premise: A 72-year-old man presents with sudden onset of right-sided weakness and slurred speech. CT scan shows an acute left middle cerebral artery territory infarct. The attending physician attributes the symptoms to low blood sugar and starts glucose infusion.
11.statement: The patient has an ischemic stroke.
11.label: entailment

12.premise: A 48-year-old woman reports progressive shortness of breath and swelling in her legs over several weeks. Echocardiogram reveals severely reduced left ventricular ejection fraction. The cardiologist diagnoses asthma and prescribes inhalers.
12.label: entailment

13.premise: A 30-year-old man presents with high fever, severe headache, neck stiffness, and photophobia. Lumbar puncture reveals cloudy cerebrospinal fluid with elevated white cell count and low glucose. The physician attributes symptoms to tension headache and prescribes analgesics.
13.label: entailment

14.premise: A 62-year-old woman experiences sudden loss of vision in one eye. Fundoscopic examination reveals a pale retina with a cherry-red spot at the macula. The ophthalmologist suspects conjunctivitis and prescribes antibiotic drops.
14.statement: The patient has central retinal artery occlusion.
14.label: entailment

15.premise: A 54-year-old male presents with severe epigastric pain radiating to the back, elevated serum lipase, and abdominal CT confirming pancreatic inflammation. The clinician diagnoses gastritis and starts proton pump inhibitors.
15.label: entailment

19.premise: A 39-year-old man reports intense thirst, frequent urination, and unexplained weight loss. Fasting blood glucose is 98 mg/dL, and HbA1c is within normal range. The physician diagnoses type 1 diabetes mellitus.

19.label: contradiction

20.premise: A 56-year-old man presents with persistent cough and hemoptysis. Chest CT is clear, with no evidence of masses or infiltrates. The physician diagnoses lung cancer and begins chemotherapy.

36.statement: Subarachnoid hemorrhage must be urgently excluded.
36.premise: A 38-year-old woman reports an abrupt 'worst headache of my life' that began during a high-intensity spin class, followed by brief nausea and neck stiffness. She is alert and oriented with no focal neurological deficits on examination. She has not yet had any neuroimaging or lumbar puncture.
36.label: entailment

37.statement: Urgent pelvic ultrasound and quantitative β-hCG testing are required to exclude ectopic pregnancy.
37.premise: A 27-year-old woman presents with lower abdominal pain predominantly on the right, light vaginal spotting, and new shoulder-tip pain. Last menstrual period was approximately 6 weeks ago. She feels lightheaded when standing but is hemodynamically stable. No pregnancy test or imaging has been done yet.
37.label: entailment

38.premise: A 34-year-old woman, two weeks postpartum, presents with sudden pleuritic chest pain and shortness of breath. Heart rate is 118 bpm, SpO2 92% on room air, and she reports mild calf discomfort after prolonged car travel yesterday. Chest auscultation is clear and a prior chest X-ray from triage was unremarkable. No D-dimer or CT pulmonary angiography has been performed.
38.label: entailment

39.statement: Emergency MRI of the lumbosacral spine is required to exclude cauda equina syndrome.
39.premise: A 55-year-old man with acute severe low back pain reports numbness in the perineal ('saddle') area, difficulty initiating urination, and bilateral leg weakness that worsened over 12 hours. Reflexes are reduced at the ankles. He has not had any spinal imaging or bladder scan yet.
39.label: entailment

40.statement: Aortic dissection must be urgently excluded.
40.premise: A 49-year-old man with a history of poorly controlled hypertension develops sudden severe tearing chest pain radiating to his back while lifting a heavy box. He is diaphoretic and mildly hypertensive on arrival. ECG shows no acute ischemic changes, and initial troponin is normal. No CT angiography or echocardiography has been performed.
40.label: entailment
